From clue 1, we know that Almond-milk and Drawing go together.

Clue 9 states that Fanta is in an even position, so it must be either 2 or 4. Clue 3 says that Fanta is on the left or right of Pop, which means Fanta cannot be in position 1 or 3 (as there's no Pop to its left/right). So, Fanta must be in position 4.

Clue 8 states that Almond-milk is somewhere to the left of Pop. Since Fanta is already in position 4, and Almond-milk can't be next to Fanta, it means Almond-milk must be in position 1.

From clue 2, we know Coffee cannot be to the left of Fanta (which is in position 4). Therefore, Coffee must be in either position 2 or 3. However, clue 10 states that Photography is between Coffee and Ambient. Since Ambient can't be next to Fanta (due to clue 6), Ambient must be in position 1. But we already have Almond-milk there! So, Ambient must actually be in position 3.

Given the above information, and using clues 5, 7, and 10, we can deduce that Indie goes with Photography (clue 10) in position 2, Singing goes with Fanta (clues 5 and 7) in position 4, and Blues is left for Skydiving in position... well, actually, Blues has no other choice but to be next to Ambient (which is not directly adjacent to Fanta), so it must be in position 3. But wait, we already have Ambient there! This means Blues can't go with Skydiving after all; instead, it goes with Photography's "neighbor" which doesn't work... unless it goes with Almond-milk! Since Almond-milk is already paired with Drawing, this forces Indie to be in position 2 (not a bad thing!), leaving only the slot between Coffee and Ambient for Blues' actual hobby. Thus, we conclude that Skydiving's genre must indeed be Blues.

Also, since the owner of the snake is on the right of the horse (clue 5), the Egyptian must be in an odd position.

From clue 9, we know that lettuce is to the left of peach. Clue 13 says that lettuce cannot be to the right of peas, so lettuce and peach must be in positions 1 and 2. Since the Egyptian is on the left or right of raspberry (clue 3), they can't be in position 4. Given clue 12 again, it's more likely that the Egyptian eats lettuce.

The Italian must be to the left of the owner of the fish (clue 2). The snake's owner is also on the left or right of the Italian (clue 7) and the fish (clue 6), so the fish can't be in position 4. Considering clue 5, the horse must be in an odd position.

Clue 11 says that the Spanish is in an even position. Since there's only one even position left, it must be position 2. Now we have lettuce in position 1 and peach in position 2.

From clue 8, peas are on the left or right of lettuce. Given that lettuce is already assigned to the Egyptian, peas can't be assigned to the same person (Egyptian). Thus, the Italian must eat peas.

We're left with raspberry for the French and snake for the owner who's not Egyptian. We know from clue 1 and 12 that it's either/or for the Egyptian between eating raspberry or owning the snake, so the French must own the snake.


This leaves us with:

From clue 10, we know that the owner of the ferret and the person driving the tram have the same parity positions. This means they must both be in odd or even positions.


|             |    1    |    2     |      3      |     4      |
| Hobby       |         | Camping  | Photography | Chess      |
| Pet         | Horse   | Ferret   | Guinea-pig  | Goldfish   |
| Transport   | Jet-ski | Taxi     | Trike       |            |
